title: L'Hospital's Rule with a function as an integral

content.prompt: Let g be a continuously differentiable function with g( 1 )=6 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3B29@ and g ′ ( 1 )=3 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3B32@ . What is lim x→1 ∫ 1 x g ( t ) dt g( x )−6 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4DF9@ ?

topic.text: 4.7: Using L'Hospital's Rule for Determining Limits of Indeterminate Forms
